name: Villain Type Generator
explanation: This generator produces a quick personality for a new villain based on villain archetype.
source: Villain archetypes and descriptions adapted from 'The Villain: Archetypes', by Word Hunter (WordPress) 8/8/2016.
to do: Improve the appearance of the output

tables.name: authorityChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: Career Bitch, The Abusive Autocrat, Dictator 
1) Corporate Climber with no morals or loyalty 
2) Holds on to power at any cost 
2) Collects sycophants who protect them 
Goal: climb to the top and stay there

tables.name: beastChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: the Monster 
1) Literally a monster with a limited mind of its own 
2) Can be heroic but misunderstood like Godzila 
Goal: feed or protect territory

tables.name: bigbadChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: power behind the throne, hidden darkness 
1) Superior to other villains 
2) Shrouds themselves in secrecy 
3) Sub-Commanders are Dragons 
{b|Goals}: maintain secrecy, oppose heroes once aware of them

tables.name: bullyChar
entries:
1) Opposes heroes directly, tormenting them intentionally 
2) Probably suffered abuse as a child 
3) May be a psychopath or sociopath 
Goal: tormant and obstruct heroes

tables.name: corruptedChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: once were good/bad politicians 
1) Started out good or not so bad and were corrupted by criminals, wealth or power 
2) Follows tropes of bad cops, bad politicians 
3) End up serving a mastermaind or big bad 
{b|Goals}: protect their secrets and live confortably

tables.name: criminalChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: thief, gentleman thief, cat burglar, thug, bankrobber 
1) Works for wealth and power it provides 
2) Can be an anti-villain or anti-hero,  
3) Solitary, but can work in a team under a mastermind or dragon 
4) Can help heroes, but will take steps to ensure they get their share of treasure that can undermine the group 
{b|Goals}: money

tables.name: darkknightChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: Dr Doom, Absolute Batman 
1) Upholds a strict code of honor that is their own that is incomprehensible to others 
2) Destroys anyone who fails to meet their standards of honor 
3) The ends always justify the means 
{b|Goals}: to rid society of everyone who fails to meet his standards of honor

tables.name: disposedheirChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: Snubbed Sibling, The Spare 
1) Born to wealth and privilege but prevented from inheriting it 
2) Has the mannerisms and comportment of a noble 
3) Extreme sense of entitlement (spoiled brat) 
4) Chronic resentment of other heir(s) 
{b|Goals}: to get back the title(s) they feel they deserve

tables.name: desperadoChar
entries:
1) On the run in their own pitiful world 
2) Could be anyone trapped by their own poor choices 
3) Running from or working for worse villains than themselves 
4) Forced into unscrupulous choices to survive 
{b|Goals}: live another day regardless of the cost and escape their fate

tables.name: devilChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: Evil Clown, Dark God, Fallen Angel, Demon, Trickster 
1) Literally the Devil on earth in humanoid form or a mind reader 
2) Can spot moral weaknesses in anyone, heroes included 
3) May have morals or principles unlike the Unhinged 
4) Enjoys playing with their 'food' as a dark comedy 
{b|Goals}: to tempt and manipulate the hero and their entourage to fall into darkness

tables.name: despotChar
entries:
1) Wants power by any means necessary 
2) Often start off as powerless victims who channel their rage into action 
3) Gathers forces as minions to justify their belief systems and do their dirty work 
4) No amount of power is enough, often conquering nations or continents 
{b|Goals}: power over everyone else

tables.name: worlddominatorChar
entries: ultimate power over an entire world, multiple worlds, a plane, multiple planes, or a multiverse

tables.name: dragonChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: The Boss 
1) Earned their way to leadership with competence and hard work 
2) Able leader ruling through respect or fear 
3) Understands long term goals 
{b|Goals}: take over the organization (secretly in some cases)

tables.name: capodragonChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: Capo, Underboss, Subcommander, Darth Vader 
1) Serves the Big Bad and believes in their motives, goals, and endgame 
2) Visible commander of the organization as the Big Bad is rarely seen 
3) So effective at leading that the Big Bad might not be noticed 
4) Only face most minions have ever seen 
{b|Goals}: command and enforce the Big Bad's will through the organization

tables.name: equalChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: Nemesis, Arch-Enemy, Mirror, General Zod, Reverse Flash 
1) Almost a doppleganger of a specific hero, but differs substantially in morals and ethics 
2) This willian will eclipse others in stories focused on said hero 
3) May ally temporarily with said hero in the face of a world-ending crisis or a crisis created by someone they despise 
{b|Goals}: match wits and win against said hero (their arch-enemy) 
Note: This is rarely seen outside of superhero and thriller genres.

tables.name: fanaticChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: Twisted Ethics, Terrorists, Cultists 
1) Single-mindedly driven by an agenda, religion, ideology, or cause (which is seldom traditional) 
{b|Goals}: succeed in their mission, even at the cost of their lives

tables.name: serialkillerChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: Misson-Oriented, Spree Killer 
1) Will fight to the death like a Madman 
2) So emotionally invested in their actions that they cannot stop killing 
3) Rarely captured alive 
{b|Goals}: fulfill their subconscious emotional needs no matter the cost

tables.name: cultleaderChar
entries:
1) Create a religion that is a cult of personality 
2) Dark empath 
3) Willing to die for their religion 
4) Create structures in their religion to replace their followers' support system with the cult 
{b|Goals}: spread their religion and make its goals a reality

tables.name: fataleChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: {fataleAssoc}  
1) Preys on their gender preference to seduce them 
2) Drains their 'paramours' financially and possibly literally (vampires) 
3) They can work for heroes or villains, often in espionage 
Goals: power over their gender preferences, money, and power
Notes: One of the few archetypes to appear in Joseph Campbell's work.

tables.name: frenemyChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: Pseudo-Buddy, Nemesis, Arch-Enemy, Psycho-Nanny, Psycho-Roommate 
1) Always appears as an ally to the hero while working against them 
2) Motivated by jealoousy or envy of the hero 
3) Highly emotional situations can make this villain's mask of caring slip or break 
Goals: destroy the hero from within

tables.name: lethalplotterChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: The Nemesis, Arch-Enemy, often the Dragon to a Mastermind  
1) Constantly planning ways to ruin the heroes' lives while profiting greatly from it 
2) Very patient in carrying out plans 
3) Always has plan B-ZZ 
4) Enjoys matching wits with heroes and outsmarting them tactically or strategically 
5) Often matches at least one of the heroes in skills  
{b|Goals}: to perform a specific crime, then getting rid of all lose ends and evidence

tables.name: machineChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: the murderous robot, the android, the husk, the supernatural or extraterrestrial beast 
1) Emotionlessly, remorselessly, mercilessly pursues its target until they are destroyed or captured. 
2) Has superior armor to the Beast 
3) Could have been more benevolent in design until now. 
{b|Goals}: destroy or capture a specific target, usually a hero

tables.name: magnificentbastardChar
entries:
1) Competent as the Dragon and ruthless as the Sadist Predator 
2) Mind reader or a devil/evil god on earth 
3) Can spot moral weaknesses in anyone, heroes included 
4) Enjoys playing with their 'food' as a dark comedy 
5) Intellectually superior to everyone beyond even the Lethal Plotter 
6) Enjoys beating heroes who challenge them 
7) Leaves cryptic clues to daunt the heroes 
{manificentbastardGoals}

tables.name: mastermindChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: the ring master, the brain, the chess-master, the puppet-master, the mad scientist, evil genius 
1) Often the Big Bad while the Dragon runs things 
2) Intellectually superior to everyone beyond even the Lethal Plotter 
3) Enjoys beating heroes who challenge them 
4) Leaves cryptic clues to daunt the heroes 
5) Puts out puzzles with ridiculously short times to complete them 
{b|Goals}: prove their superiority while wiping out challengers

tables.name: corruptorsubtypeChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: the puppet-master 
1) Often the Big Bad while the Dragon runs things 
2) Intellectually superior to everyone beyond even the Lethal Plotter 
3) Focuses on corrupting other villains into doing their bidding 
4) Inevitably will try to corrupt everyone, heroes included 
{b|Goals}: prove their superiority by corrupting and dominating the entire world

tables.name: clanoppressorChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: {clanoppressorAssoc} 
1) Family tyrants who will do 'anything for family' as long it is also personally self-serving 
2) Expects unconditional love and loyalty while giving at best transactional returns 
3) Disposes of anyone failing their loyalty tests 
{b|Goals}: rule over the clan that unconditionally loves them 
Notes: This is an overdone trope in YA books and games.

tables.name: minionChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: Villain’s sidekicks, thugs, henchmen, sports villains, jocks, heels (wrestling term for villains) 
1) Craves the same profits as the villain they serve 
2) Serve villlains they perceive as smarter than they are 
3) May seek to be a mastermind or dragon if smart or resoureful 
{b|Goals}: profit from working for the bigger villain's goals

tables.name: sportsChar
entries:
1) Has special training in martial arts or specific sports that make them more formidable 
2) Never question their training.

tables.name: outsiderChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: outcast, hermit, outsider 
1) Seems like a decent person but will not join new groups 
2) Pines for old life before being 'unjustly' exiled 
3) Mask eventually slips, revealing why they were exiled 
4) A little investigation by a party could reveal the true depths of their depravity 
{outsiderGoals}

tables.name: predatorChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: the sadist, the menace, barbarian 
1) Consumed by bloodlust 
2) Fights and kills for sport without regret or remorse 
3) Enjoys using their hunting skills to violently and brutally kill, often turning it into games 
4) If unable to setup own games, will hire out as a mercenary or assassin 
{b|Goals}: to kill, maim, and destory for sport

tables.name: schadenfreudeChar
entries:
1) Manipulative sadist 
2) Craves hurting people physically and/or mentally 
{b|Goals}: take their time sadistically killing a target

tables.name: menaceChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: the Lost Boys 
1) Psychopathic in the use of violence  
2) Instead of hunting, they pick a place (e.g. a tavern) to rampage and destroy 
3) Unconcerned about discovery or capture 
{b|Goals}: rampaging in a small area as along as feasible

tables.name: completemonsterChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: spree killer 
1) Lowest rung of sadism 
2) No redeeming qualities 
3) Never stop rampaging and killing 
4) Target entire villages and kill, torture, and prolong deaths of every living thing there 
5) Cannot be reasoned with 
{b|Goals}: torture murdering every liviing thing on the planet
Notes: This is a very difficult type to write about and generate way too many triggers.

tables.name: traitorChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: {traitorAssoc} 
1) Will betray anyone, friends and loved ones included, to save themselves 
2) Cowardly manipulates and deceives others to get information 
3) Will perform acts of treachery and treason if they can do so safely 
4) Often pretends to support and befriend targets, including heroes 
{b|Goals}: provide information about the hero to their opposition to ruin their objectives

tables.name: unhingedChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: {unhingedAssoc} 
1) Might need a shell persona to hide the insanity of this villain 
2) Motives of their actions often make little sense 
3) Probably a monster created by monsters in childhood 
4) May oppose hero just because... 
{b|Goals}: not predictable, although it will involve hurting/destroying the hero specifically

tables.name: vengefulChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: vigilante, punisher 
1) Feels wronged by someone or society and cannot get over it 
2) The wrong might not be somethng that makes sense to others 
3) Intentionally grew in power and wealth to be able to exact revenge on their enemies 
4) Consider themselves above societal norms or their targets beyond the ability of society to deliver justice 
{b|Goals}: obtain vengeance for a perceived injustice

tables.name: victimChar
entries:
{b|Other names}: the innocent, the child 
1) 'Someone else made me do it' 
2) Denies responsibility for all atttrocities 
3) As long as they feel safe, will commit any attrocity 
4) Never feels guilt for attrocities, but does feel wrongly judged by others for doing it 
5) Utterly unreliable witness 
{b|Goals}: cast blame on others for their actions

tables.name: fataleAssoc
entries: seductress, Goddess, enchantress, black widow, courtesan, gigolo, swindlers, con-artists, Don Juan, honey traps, psychic or physical vampires

tables.name: clanoppressorAssoc
entries: Tiger Mom, Mummy Dearest, Helicopter Parents, Bad Mother, Wicked Stepmother, Evil Queen, Clan Despot, Evil King

tables.name: traitorAssoc
entries: the betrayer, two-face, tattle-tale, treasoner, whistle-blower, spy, secret agent (on the baddie’s side). saboteur, back-stabber

tables.name: unhingedAssoc
entries: mad woman, mad man, deranged, lunatic, psycho, maniac, rogue, the disturbed, scorned woman, stalker-ex, the Joker, the Riddler, Norman Bates, Annie Wilkes

tables.name: devilTraits
entries:
* Can spot moral weaknesses in anyone, heroes included 
* May have morals or principles unlike the Unhinged 
* Enjoys playing with their 'food' as a dark comedy

tables.name: manificentbastardGoals
entries: {b|Goals}: World Domination but via a very slow and enjoyable route.

tables.name: outsiderGoals
entries:
{b|Goals}: Pick 1+ from the following: 
1) Seeks horrific ritual sacrifices 
2) Is in fact a cannibal or eats humanoids outside their species 
3) Extreme xenophobe who wants to eliminate certain groups or species 
4) Redemption at any cost and will sacrifice anyone to get it
